DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to see if an online program for patients with diabetes helps patients improve their self-care (how they take their medications, what they eat, how much they exercise, and whether they smoke).
DOC.brief_title: An Online System to Improve Diabetes Self-Care
DOC.detailed_description: Patient portals are online programs that can provide a number of functions for patients, among them: - Ability to request appointments, referrals, and medication refills; - Ability to send secure electronic messages to medical staff, and to receive replies; - Access to the medical record; - Disease management We are comparing two patient portals with different sets of features to determine if personalized information and guidance can improve self-care and measures of diabetes-related health. Self-care measures will be assessed using standardized questionnaires at baseline, 3, and 6 months. Chart review will be used to assess measures of diabetes-related health.
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes mellitus Has access to Internet Has email address Established patient at one of four participating practices at University of Colorado Hospital NonEnglish speaking
